title: Generate a standard load profile
text: call slp_generate() generate standard load profile given one, profile identifiers. steps performed: Generate date sequence start_date end_date Map day combination day period Use result 2nd step extract values slp2 Apply polynomial function values profile identifier H0 Return data3

title: Generate a standard load profile
text: first step date sequence created start_date end_date based user input. simple example; result vector class Date:

what: Map each day to a period and a weekday
title: Generate a standard load profile
text: study found consumption varies course year days within week analyzing 1,209 measured load profiles low-voltage customers. definition periods : summer: May 15 September 14 winter: November 1 March 20 transition: March 21 May 14, September 15 October 31 However, also found significant difference consumption Monday Friday group. reason, days Monday Friday grouped together ‘workdays’. December 24th 31th considered Saturday , Sunday, public holidays set Sunday. Note: package standardlastprofile supports public holidays Germany. retrieved nager.Date API listed nationwide holidays 2024: Jan 1: New Year’s Mar 29: Good Friday Apr 1: Easter Monday May 1: Labor Day May 9: Ascension Day May 20: Whit Monday Oct 3: German Unity Day Dec 25: Christmas Day Dec 26: Boxing Day result second step mapping date -called characteristic profile day, .e. combination weekday period:
code: wkday_period <- standardlastprofile:::get_wkday_period(date_seq) data.frame(date = date_seq, day = wkday_period) #>         date             day #> 1 2023-12-22  workday_winter #> 2 2023-12-23 saturday_winter #> 3 2023-12-24   sunday_winter #> 4 2023-12-25   sunday_winter #> 5 2023-12-26   sunday_winter #> 6 2023-12-27  workday_winter

what: Assign consumption values to each day
title: Generate a standard load profile
text: third step assign measurements know slp dataset characteristic profile day. job slp_generate() function: found load fluctuations commercial agricultural customers moderate. , customers/customer groups G0 G6, L0 L2 standard load profile can determined directly 3x3 characteristic profile days. code reproduce plot profile G5 README, can see result algorithm:  can see, 2023 values December 24th, 2024 (Sunday), December 25th, 26th (public holidays).
code: G5 <- slp_generate(   profile_id = "G5",   start_date = "2023-12-22",   end_date = "2023-12-27"   ) library(ggplot2) ggplot(G5, aes(start_time, watts)) +   geom_line(color = "#0CC792") +   scale_x_datetime(     date_breaks = "1 day",     date_labels = "%b %d") +   labs(     title = "'G5': bakery with bakehouse",     subtitle = "1/4h-measurements, based on consumption of 1,000 kWh/a",     caption = "data: www.bdew.de",     x = NULL,     y = "[watts]") +   theme_minimal() +   theme(       panel.grid.minor.x = element_blank(),       panel.grid.minor.y = element_blank()   ) +   NULL

title: Generate a standard load profile
text: contrast commercial agricultural businesses, relatively even fairly constant power consumption course year, households hand continuously decreasing electricity consumption winter summer (Germany), et vice versa. fact taken account call slp_generate(). study suggested application 4th order polynomial function electric power values profile identifier H0: \[ x = x_0 \times(-3.92\mathrm{e}{-10} \times d^4 + 3.20\mathrm{e}{-7} \times  d^3 - 7.02\mathrm{e}{-5} \times d^2 + 2.10\mathrm{e}{-3} \times d + 1.24) \] : \(x\) resulting ‘dynamic’ quarter-hour value \(x_0\) static quarter-hourly value \(d\) day year integer, starting 1 January 1st following plot shows electrical power develops year profile identifier H0. clearer picture, values aggregated daily level:

text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

what: R data package for load profiles for electricity
title: R data package for load profiles for electricity
text: package provides data representative, standard load profiles electricity German Association Energy Water Industries (BDEW Bundesverband der Energie- und Wasserwirtschaft e.V.) tidy format.

title: R data package for load profiles for electricity
text: install development version standardlastprofile GitHub call:

title: R data package for load profiles for electricity
text: standardlastprofile package contains one dataset called slp. total 9,504 observations 5 variables: profile_id: identifier standard load profile period: one “summer”, “winter”, “transition” day: one “saturday”, “sunday”, “workday” timestamp: format “%H:%M” watts: electric power standard load profile can used basis energy utilities create annual consumption forecast customers. simplification necessarily correspond consumption profile individual customer, represents valid approximation larger group similar customers. combination profile_id, period day 96 x 1/4h-measurements watts. idea H0 stands , alone. H0: households (German: “Haushalte”) G0 G6: commerce (“Gewerbe”) L0 L2: agriculture (“Landwirtschaft”) Call slp_info() information.
code: str(slp) #> 'data.frame':    9504 obs. of  5 variables: #>  $ profile_id: chr  "H0" "H0" "H0" "H0" ... #>  $ period    : chr  "winter" "winter" "winter" "winter" ... #>  $ day       : chr  "saturday" "saturday" "saturday" "saturday" ... #>  $ timestamp : chr  "00:00" "00:15" "00:30" "00:45" ... #>  $ watts     : num  70.8 68.2 65.9 63.3 59.5 55 50.5 46.6 43.9 42.3 ... slp_info(language = "EN")$H0 #> $profile #> [1] "H0" #>  #> $description #> [1] "household" #>  #> $details #> [1] "This profile includes all households with exclusively and predominantly private consumption. Households with predominantly private electrical consumption, i.e. also with minor commercial consumption are e.g. sales representatives, home workers, etc. with an office in the household. The Household profile is not applicable for special applications such as storage heaters or heat pumps."

title: R data package for load profiles for electricity
text: Use function slp_generate() gernate standard load profile given period time:  See vignette("algorithm-step--step", package = "standardlastprofile") detailed explanation algorithm.

title: R data package for load profiles for electricity
text: Data information methodology can found website BDEW: https://www.bdew.de/energie/standardlastprofile-strom/

title: R data package for load profiles for electricity
text: Please note project released Contributor Code Conduct. participating project agree abide terms.

what: Standard Load Profile Data for Electricity from BDEW — slp
title: Standard Load Profile Data for Electricity from BDEW — slp
text: Data representative, standard load profiles electricity German Association Energy Water Industries (BDEW Bundesverband der Energie- und Wasserwirtschaft e.V.) tidy format.

title: Standard Load Profile Data for Electricity from BDEW — slp
Standard Load Profile Data for Electricity from BDEW — slp
text: data.frame 9,504 observations 5 variables: profile_id character, identifier load profile, see 'Details' period character, one 'summer', 'winter', 'transition' day character, one 'saturday', 'sunday', 'workday' timestamp character, format: %H:%M watt numeric, electric power

title: Standard Load Profile Data for Electricity from BDEW — slp
text: https://www.bdew.de/energie/standardlastprofile-strom/ https://www.bdew.de/media/documents/Profile.zip https://www.bdew.de/media/documents/1999_Repraesentative-VDEW-Lastprofile.pdf https://www.bdew.de/media/documents/2000131_Anwendung-repraesentativen_Lastprofile-Step--step.pdf

title: Standard Load Profile Data for Electricity from BDEW — slp
text: 96 x 1/4h measurements electrical power combination profile_id, period day, refer "standard load profile". data determined 1999 basis 1,209 measured load profiles low-voltage customers Germany. profile identifier measurements normalized correspond annual consumption 1,000 kWh. sum quarter-hourly consumption values one year, result (approximately) 1,000 kWh/. See vignette("algorithm-step--step") information. total 11 representative, standard load profiles 3 different customer groups: households: H0 commercial: G0, G1, G2, G3, G4, G5, G6 agriculture: L0, L1, L2 Call slp_info() information examples. Periods defined : summer: May 15 September 14 winter: November 1 March 20 transition: March 21 May 14, September 15 October 31 3 different characteristic days: workday: Monday Friday saturday: Saturdays; Dec 24th Dec 31th considered Saturday , Sunday sunday: Sundays public holidays Germany

title: Standard Load Profile Data for Electricity from BDEW — slp
code: head(slp) #>   profile_id period      day timestamp watts #> 1         H0 winter saturday     00:00  70.8 #> 2         H0 winter saturday     00:15  68.2 #> 3         H0 winter saturday     00:30  65.9 #> 4         H0 winter saturday     00:45  63.3 #> 5         H0 winter saturday     01:00  59.5 #> 6         H0 winter saturday     01:15  55.0  # There are 96 observations for each combination of profile_id, period and day tmp <- subset(slp, profile_id == "L0" & period == "summer" & day == "workday") dim(tmp) #> [1] 96  5

what: Generate a Standard Load Profile — slp_generate
title: Generate a Standard Load Profile — slp_generate
text: Generate standard load profile normalized annual consumption 1,000 kWh.

title: Generate a Standard Load Profile — slp_generate
Generate a Standard Load Profile — slp_generate
text: https://www.bdew.de/energie/standardlastprofile-strom/ https://www.bdew.de/media/documents/1999_Repraesentative-VDEW-Lastprofile.pdf https://www.bdew.de/media/documents/2000131_Anwendung-repraesentativen_Lastprofile-Step--step.pdf

title: Generate a Standard Load Profile — slp_generate
text: profile_id load profile identifier, see 'Details'. start_date start date ISO 8601 format, required end_date end date ISO 8601 format, required

title: Generate a Standard Load Profile — slp_generate
text: data.frame four variables: profile_id, character, load profile identifier start_time, POSIXct / POSIXlt, start time end_time, POSIXct / POSIXlt, end time watts, numeric, electric power

title: Generate a Standard Load Profile — slp_generate
text: every day 96 x 1/4h measurements electrical power combination profile_id, period day. profile identifier measurements normalized correspond annual consumption 1,000 kWh. sum quarter-hourly consumption values one year, result (approximately) 1,000 kWh/, see 'Examples' call vignette("algorithm-step--step") information. total 11 representative, standard load profiles 3 different customer groups: households: H0 commercial: G0, G1, G2, G3, G4, G5, G6 agriculture: L0, L1, L2 Call slp_info() information examples. Definition periods: summer: May 15 September 14 winter: November 1 March 20 transition: March 21 May 14, September 15 October 31 Definition characteristic days: saturday: Saturdays; Dec 24th Dec 31th considered Saturday , Sunday sunday: Sundays public holidays workday: Monday Friday Note: package supports nationwide, public holidays Germany. retrieved nager.Date API. start_date must greater equal "1990-01-01", end_date must smaller equal "2073-12-31". public holidays Germany ambitious reunification 1990, 2073 latest year supported nager.Date API.

title: Generate a Standard Load Profile — slp_generate

title: Get the description load profiles according to the BDEW — slp_info
text: language one 'EN' (English), 'DE' (German)

title: Get the description load profiles according to the BDEW — slp_info
text: data.frame

title: Get the description load profiles according to the BDEW — slp_info
code: slp_info(language = "EN")$G6 #> $profile #> [1] "G6" #>  #> $description #> [1] "weekend business" #>  #> $details #> [1] "Commercial facilities with a clear focus on consumption at weekends. In particular, these are all businesses characterized by the leisure activities of the population: youth clubs, restaurants and cafés, petrol stations with car washes, cinemas with food outlets, sports and leisure facilities." #>  slp_info(language = "DE")$G6 #> $profile #> [1] "G6" #>  #> $description #> [1] "Wochenendbetrieb" #>  #> $details #> [1] "Betriebe mit deutlichen Verbrauchsschwerpunkt an den Wochenenden. Das sind insbesondere alle durch die Freizeitaktivitäten der Bevölkerung geprägten Geschäfte: Jugendclubs, Ausflugs- und Speisegaststätten, Tankstellen mit Waschanlagen, Kinos mit Verzehr, Sport- und Freizeiteinrichtungen." #>

what: standardlastprofile: R data package for load profiles for electricity — standardlastprofile-package
title: standardlastprofile: R data package for load profiles for electricity — standardlastprofile-package
text: package provides data standardized load profiles German Association Energy Water Industries (BDEW Bundesverband der Energie- und Wasserwirtschaft e.V.) tidy format. data published 1999 since formed basis energy suppliers approximate estimated electricity consumption customers. standardized load profile describes consumption profile energy consumer certain period time. package also provides interface generate load profile user specified period time.

title: standardlastprofile: R data package for load profiles for electricity — standardlastprofile-package
text: Maintainer: Markus Döring m4rkus.doering@gmail.com
